newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline pulled higher by NYMEX unleaded gains.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline pulled higher by NYMEX unleaded gains.

text.p: NWE gasoline was propelled higher by sharp gains in crude and unleaded futures on Monday, traders said.
Eurograde barges were talked around $191/193 for prompt delivery and were done at $192, while May delivery was talked at $195/$197 and traded at $194 and $195.
May Eurograde swaps were around $197/$198 fob ARA, while June swaps were at $193.50/$194.50. Regular barges traded at $189 for first half May delivery and $186 for prompt material.
On the cargo front, premium unleaded was assessed at $196/$197 cif NWE.
Traders attributed higher prices to surging crude and unleaded futures. May gasoline was trading 1.26 cents at 62.75 cents a gallon at 1713 GMT, while June was 1.16 cents higher at 62.10 cents.
Traders said the arbitrage door to the United States remained shut for smaller cargoes although bigger 60,000 tonne crossings could be just about worthwhile.
Shipbrokers reported GE Warren chartered a 60,000 tonne vessel to carry unleaded gasoline from East coast Britain to the U.S. Atlantic coast loading May 4, at a rate of W180.
